subject: Re: new to esclipse and can't get junit configured
msgSnippet: Point of clarification, the PHP Eclipse does ship with enough Java components where I was able to write some sample apps with it and run them.

Point of clarification, the PHP Eclipse does ship with enough Java componen=
ts where I was able to write some sample apps with it and run them.

--- In=
 junit@yahoogroups.com, "nuttzy99" <nuttzy@...> wrote:
>
> Hey Guys,
> 
> I=
 GOT IT!  Between the two of you, you had the right answer ;-)  In the "Ins=
tall New Software" dialog under Galileo there was nothing there specific to=
 JUnit.  But it occurred to me that installing "EPP Java Package" and "Java=
 EE IDE Feature" was a reasonable thing to do.
> 
> Did that and now JUnit =
4.5 is install and I can access the features I previously mentioned were la=
cking.
> 
> Thanks!
>
